pullRequest.body:
This PR adds documentation to the `declarations_diff` script.

Consequence of #15149.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [e96d00831f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15195/commits/e96d00831f23fcf3fc0b23778a85c01433162487)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>
The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
@riccardobrasca @semorrison I am pinging you, since the motivation for writing this doc-module came from your comments on #15149.

Thanks!

bors d+

:v: adomani can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10134711756/job/28021269264)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10134711756/job/28021269089)
Two last, very easy, comments - feel free to maintainer merge on my behalf once you have considered them.
I also gave this a look - a few minor suggestions only. Thanks for documenting this!
Michael, thank you for your comments: I implemented them all!
Two last, very easy, comments - feel free to maintainer merge on my behalf once you have considered them.

```suggestion
with namespacing, e.g. you could see it with `+++-- map_zero`.
```
With `++--` it would be silent, right?

No, it is silent exactly with one of `+-` or `-+`.  As soon as there are more matches (or exactly one match), it reports everything.  So you can see `+`, `-`, `++-`, `++--`, `+-+-`,...  You are guaranteed to *not* see `+-` and `+-`, since this is a "perfect pair".  If more declarations are in the mix, then the script flags it, so that you can make sure that there are no issues.

```suggestion
In essence, it looks at the output of `git diff origin/master...HEAD`, extracts the lines that

```suggestion
This means that a declaration `thmName` was added 3 times and removed twice: this can happen
You could mention namespacing already up here, say like "the declaration ids as given by the diff --- in particular, not considering namespacing". What do you think?
Good point: I added a sentence mentioning that the script ignores namespaces.

It took me a moment to parse this sentence: is this one clearer to you?
```
* It assumes that the keyword (as above) appears on the same line as the corresponding declaration id --- for instance, a line break between `theorem` and `riemannHypothesis` fools the script.
Thanks: your formulation does seem clearer.
Do you know where this is documented? I'm unable to find this in the bash manual.

This is a trick that I learned by googling for multiline comments in bash.  The colon `:` is a no-op command and `<<TEXT...TEXT` is how you can pass the command inside `TEXT` to a previous one, similar to a redirection: you redirect random text as an argument to a command that does nothing with it.  Finally, the single quotes around the first `TEXT` avoid some parsing of the intervening text, but I forgot exactly what.

Thanks for explaining. In essence, `BASH_DOC_MODULE` is not a magic variable (you could have written `DamianoWritesRandomStuff` instead) and has no further effect, right --- so this is basically a multi-line comment?
Yes, exactly: any text that does not "randomly appear" in what follows, until you repeat it gets ignored.  I chose `BASH_DOC_MODULE` to communicate what the intent of the following text was.

```suggestion
* It assumes that the keyword (as above) appears on the same line as the corresponding
I also changed `the keyword` to `each keyword: I am not committing this suggestion to avoid merge conflicts.

```suggestion
  declaration id --- a line break between `theorem` and `riemannHypothesis` fools the script.
Would writing "exactly once" here alleviate Riccardo's concern below?
Done!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - docs: add module docs for `declarations_diff`
